head.supplied: Copy ¶ Melbourne bot. Gardens ¶ 11/9/63 ¶ Dear & honorable Sir, ¶ ¶ The incoming mail brought a letter from Prof Dr Maskelyne the Custos of the mineralogical collections in the British Museum, in reg...

div.p: Bundle 10, no. 12, unit 11, VPRS 1095 special files, VA 466 Governor, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
Dr George Evans, MLA, was the chairman of a Board appointed to recommend actions to be taken on the large meteorite purchased by James Bruce for presentation to the British Museum, when attempts were made to keep it in Victoria. Bruce had appointed M as his agent. The Board had originally met without inviting M to give evidence (H. Barkly to M, 22 May 1863). See also M to C. Darling, 28 November 1863. Copy

The incoming mail brought a letter from Prof Dr Maskelyne the Custos of the mineralogical collections in the British Museum, in regard to the Meteorite. I should feel grateful if the Board could be called together at an early day, in order, that my explanation may be received and the report be drawn up for final consideration of the Government, and perhaps you will be so friendly to endeavour that these proceedings may be closed in such a time as to allow me to reply to Prof Maskelyne by next mail.

I am also anxious to express to the Board my willingness to relinquish the position of representing on this occasion the interest of the British Museum and to resign to Mr Bruce again the trust he imposed on me, even if it were only to show, that I have no personal interest whatsoever in the transmission of the Bruce Meteorite to London, but that I advocate this measure simply on universal claims of science
